mainAssignment.title: Build a Neural Network Classifier
mainAssignment.description: Implement a multi-layer perceptron using NumPy to classify handwritten digits from the MNIST dataset. Your network should have at least one hidden layer and use backpropagation for training.

critiques.message: Good initialization of weights using random normal distribution.
Consider using Xavier or He initialization for better convergence.
Missing activation functions. Add sigmoid or ReLU for hidden layers.

recommendation.title: Implementation Hint
recommendation.message: Use the sigmoid activation function and its derivative for backpropagation.

mainAssignment.title: Implement a Custom Thread Pool
mainAssignment.description: Create a custom thread pool executor in Java that manages a fixed number of worker threads. Implement proper task queuing, thread lifecycle management, and graceful shutdown mechanisms.

critiques.message: Good use of BlockingQueue for thread-safe task management.
Worker threads should be daemon threads to allow JVM shutdown.
Missing proper thread interruption handling in shutdown method.

recommendation.title: Thread Management Tip
recommendation.message: Create a Worker class that extends Thread and continuously polls the task queue.

mainAssignment.title: Build a RESTful API with Authentication
mainAssignment.description: Create an ASP.NET Core Web API with JWT authentication. Implement user registration, login endpoints, and protect routes using authorization middleware.

critiques.message: Correct use of ApiController attribute and route templates.
Password should be hashed using BCrypt or PBKDF2 before storing.
JWT secret key should be stored in configuration, not hardcoded.

recommendation.title: JWT Implementation
recommendation.message: Use JwtSecurityTokenHandler to create tokens with proper claims.

mainAssignment.title: Implement Secure Password Hashing
mainAssignment.description: Develop a secure password hashing mechanism for the user authentication module. You must use a cryptographically strong salt and a slow hashing algorithm (like PBKDF2 or Argon2) to prevent rainbow table attacks.

aiFeedback.title: Security Audit Report
aiFeedback.subtitle: Based on your latest code analysis

critiques.message: Correctly identified the need for hashlib library and os module for randomness.
Recommendation: Use at least 100,000 iterations for PBKDF2 to slow down brute-force attacks.
Critical: Passwords are currently being stored without proper salting in the previous attempt.

recommendation.title: Secure Implementation Hint
recommendation.message: Always generate a cryptographically strong random salt for every user before hashing. Do not reuse salts.
recommendation.codeSnippet:
# Generate 32 bytes salt
salt = os.urandom(32)
# Hash with PBKDF2
key = hashlib.pbkdf2_hmac(
  'sha256',
  password.encode('utf-8'),
  salt,
  100000
)

mainAssignment.title: Implement Page Object Model
mainAssignment.description: Create a robust Page Object Model framework for automating a login flow. Implement proper element locators, reusable methods, and handle synchronization issues using explicit waits.

codeEditor.code:
from selenium import webdriver
from selenium.webdriver.common.by import By
from selenium.webdriver.support.ui import WebDriverWait

class LoginPage:
    def __init__(self, driver):
        self.driver = driver
        # TODO: Define locators
        self.username_field = (By.ID, "username")
        self.password_field = (By.ID, "password")
        
    def login(self, username, password):
        # TODO: Implement login method with explicit waits
        pass

critiques.message: Good practice using tuple format for locators (By.ID, 'value').
Use WebDriverWait with expected_conditions for reliable element interaction.
Missing error handling for stale element references.

recommendation.title: Wait Strategy
recommendation.message: Implement explicit waits for better synchronization.
recommendation.codeSnippet:
from selenium.webdriver.support import expected_conditions as EC

wait = WebDriverWait(self.driver, 10)
element = wait.until(
    EC.element_to_be_clickable(self.username_field)
)

mainAssignment.title: Implement a Custom Memory Allocator
mainAssignment.description: Create a custom memory allocator in C that manages a fixed-size memory pool. Implement malloc-like and free-like functions with proper memory alignment and fragmentation handling.

aiFeedback.title: Memory Management Review
aiFeedback.subtitle: Based on your latest attempt

critiques.message: Good use of metadata structure to track block information.
Consider implementing memory alignment to prevent unaligned access.
Missing boundary checks can lead to buffer overflow vulnerabilities.

recommendation.title: Implementation Hint
recommendation.message: Use pointer arithmetic carefully and always validate block boundaries.

aiFeedback.buttonText: Ask AI for C programming tips

mainAssignment.title: Implement a Retry Decorator
mainAssignment.description: Create a Python decorator named @retry that automatically retries a function call if it raises an exception. It should accept arguments for the number of retries and the delay between attempts.

critiques.message: Great use of functools.wraps. This ensures the metadata of the original function is preserved.
You're catching exceptions, but are you re-raising the last one if all retries fail? The current implementation might return None silently.
Variable scope issue: Ensure the retries counter is correctly handled within the closure or loop.

recommendation.title: Retry Recommendation
recommendation.message: Try using a while loop inside your wrapper instead of recursion to manage the retry count more easily.
